item.title: 泰国将于下月启动 BOT 新行长遴选程序
item.description: 泰国预计将于下月任命一个小组来挑选央行行长塞萨普-素提瓦特那鲁普特（Sethaput Suthiwartnarueput）的继任者。【原文：Thailand expects to appoint a panel next month to pick a successor to central bank governor Sethaput Suthiwartnarueput, who has sparred with the government on how best to manage Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 挪威1月份核心通货膨胀率意外加快
item.description: 挪威的基本通胀率出人意料地加快了步伐，这很可能使人们对挪威银行下月首次降息计划之后的政策前景产生怀疑。【原文：Norway’s underlying inflation unexpectedly picked up pace, likely raising doubts about the outlook for Norges Bank’s policy beyond its first planned interest-rate cut next month.】

item.title: 供应担忧加剧，欧洲天然气价格创两年新高
item.description: 由于气温降低加速了该地区储气设施的消耗，欧洲天然气价格升至两年来的最高点。【原文：European natural gas prices rose to a two-year high as colder temperatures accelerate the depletion of the region’s storage facilities.】

item.title: 富士媒体股价升至 17 年新高，Rheos 持股 5
item.description: 日本 Rheos Capital Works 周五报告称持有富士媒体控股公司 5%的股份后，该公司股价最高上涨 7.5%，达到 2007 年以来的最高水平。【原文：Shares of Fuji Media Holdings Inc. rose as much as 7.5% to the highest level since 2007 after Japan’s Rheos Capital Works reported it had a 5% stake on Friday.】

item.title: 菲律宾 Maharlika 公司与泰国 CP 集团合资成立 10 亿美元股票基金
item.description: 菲律宾主权财富公司与泰国 CP 集团签署了一项组建私募股权基金的协议，目标规模高达 10 亿美元，这是该公司在不到一个月的时间内采取的第二项重大投资行动。【原文：The Philippines’ sovereign wealth firm has signed a deal to form a private equity fund with Thailand’s CP Group with a target size of up to $1 billion, marking its second major investment move in less than a month.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市将走高，关税风险迫在眉睫
埃及通胀略有放缓，央行考虑削减开支
item.description: 埃及 1 月份的通胀率仅略有放缓，这可能使央行自 2020 年以来首次降息的时机变得更加复杂。【原文：Egypt’s inflation slowed only slightly in January, potentially complicating the timing of the central bank’s first interest-rate cuts since 2020.】

item.title: 台湾对墨西哥的出口在美国加征关税前猛增近 500
item.description: 随着科技公司将生产迁出中国，台湾对墨西哥的出口创下历史新高，但在美国威胁对其邻国征收更高的关税后，这一贸易现在面临着不确定性。【原文：Taiwan’s exports to Mexico surged by a record as tech companies moved production out of China, but the trade now faces uncertainty following US threats of higher tariffs on its neighbor.】

item.title: 中国在让市场决定清洁电力价格方面迈出一大步
item.description: 中国正准备取消可再生能源的固定价格，让市场决定用户为清洁电力支付多少费用。【原文：China is preparing to scrap fixed pricing on renewable power, and let the market decide how much users pay for clean electricity.】

item.title: 台积电 1 月份销售额增长放缓，DeepSeek 引发市场动荡
item.description: 由于英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）旗下的主要芯片制造商正努力应对整个行业对人工智能支出的质疑，台湾积体电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.’s sales growth decelerated from the December quarter as Nvidia Corp.’s main chipmaker grapples with industry-wide questions surrounding AI spending.】

item.title: 中国可能从保险公司腾出 270 亿美元投资黄金
item.description: 中国的一项试点计划首次允许保险公司购买黄金，这将释放数十亿美元的潜在贵金属投资，进一步推动创纪录的涨势。【原文：A Chinese pilot program to allow insurers to buy gold for the first time will free up billions of dollars of potential investment in the precious metal, adding further impetus to a record-setting rally.】

item.title: 高盛认为特朗普移民举措将削弱美国经济增长
item.description: 高盛集团经济学家表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统的移民限制措施将对美国经济和劳动力增长产生一定程度的负面影响，而对通胀的影响则更为有限。【原文：President Donald Trump’s immigration restrictions are set to have a somewhat negative impact on US economic and labor force growth, with an even more limited effect on inflation, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc. economists.】

item.title: 日本经常账户盈余在特朗普的不确定性中创纪录
item.description: 日本的经常账户盈余在 2024 年创下历史新高，日元的疲软抬高了海外投资回报的价值。【原文：Japan’s current-account surplus hit a record high in 2024 with the yen’s weakness inflating the value of overseas investment returns, in a bullish development that comes just as US President Donald Trump’s economic policies cloud the outlook.】

item.title: 美国消费者 "特朗普错乱综合症 "来袭
item.description:
如果贸易战动真格的，他就不能指望他们的应变能力了。【原文：

He can’t count on their resilience if the trade war gets real.

】

item.title: 人口危机加剧，中国婚姻降至历史最低点
item.description: 去年，中国的结婚率骤降五分之一，降至有记录以来的最低水平，政府为扭转威胁世界第二大经济体的人口危机所做的努力遭遇挫折。【原文：Marriages in China plunged by a fifth to the lowest level on record last year, a setback to efforts by the government to reverse a demographic crisis threatening the world’s second-biggest economy.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税政策让货币交易在多年下滑后再度降温
item.description:
银行和对冲基金正在加强外汇交易部门，因为波动性提高了利润。【原文：

Banks and hedge funds are beefing up their foreign exchange desks as volatility boosts profits.

】

item.title: 欧洲天然气期权交易商押注夏季供应量激增
item.description: 欧洲天然气交易商正在进行一场不同寻常的季节性押注，他们认为天然气价格到夏季将上涨近 50%，因为他们希望为明年冬季储备燃料。【原文：European natural gas traders are piling into an unusual seasonal bet — that prices will gain almost 50% by the summer — as they look to stockpile fuel for next winter.】

item.title: 外卖英雄终于盈利，向亚洲更大的竞争对手发起挑战
item.description: 德国的 Delivery Hero 多年来一直在逐步实现盈利，这在利润微薄的行业中实属罕见。现在，面对与更大竞争对手的激烈价格战，它必须保持这些利润。【原文：Germany’s Delivery Hero spent years inching toward profitability, a rare feat in an industry with razor-thin margins. Now it has to keep those profits in the face of grueling price wars with bigger rivals.】

item.title: 美国企业称环境、社会和公司治理规则日益成为欧盟贸易的障碍
item.description: 在针对欧洲环境、社会和治理法规的批评者名单中，美国公司的声音越来越多。【原文：US companies are adding their voice to the list of critics targeting ESG regulations in Europe.】

item.title: 印度市场准备应对 35 亿美元即将到期的 IPO 锁定额
item.description: 超过 35 亿美元的新上市印度股票的销售限制将于周一到期，这给自 12 月中旬以来已经缩水约 1 万亿美元的股市增加了压力。【原文：Sale restrictions on more than $3.5 billion of newly listed Indian shares are set to expire on Monday, adding pressure to a stock market that has already erased about $1 trillion in value since mid December.】

item.title: 芬太尼为何成为新一轮中美贸易之争的焦点？
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统对所有中国进口商品全面征收 10%关税的行政命令于 2 月 4 日生效。这项全面的进口税是在特朗普在其第一任总统任期内对某些中国商品和行业征收关税、并由其继任者乔-拜登（Joe Biden）扩大征税范围的基础上实施的。【原文：President Donald Trump’s executive order imposing an across-the-board 10% tariff on all Chinese imports went into effect on Feb. 4. The comprehensive import tax comes on top of tariffs already in place on certain Chinese goods and sectors that were imposed by Trump during his first presidency and expanded by his successor, Joe Biden.】

item.title: 特朗普征收金属关税，魁北克呼吁尽早商谈贸易协议
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示计划对所有美国进口钢铁和铝征收 25% 的关税后，魁北克省省长表示，加拿大应努力加快北美贸易协定的重新谈判。【原文：Canada should try to accelerate the renegotiation of the North American trade agreement, Quebec’s premier said, after US President Donald Trump said he plans to put 25% tariffs on all US steel and aluminum imports.】

item.title: 即使放宽了黄金签证规定，新西兰仍将外国购房者拒之门外
item.description: 新西兰对外国购房者的禁令仍将是一些海外投资者的症结所在，因为他们希望利用更为宽松的黄金签证计划。【原文：New Zealand’s ban on foreign home buyers will remain a sticking point for some overseas investors as they look to take advantage of a more permissive golden visa program.】

item.title: 特朗普要求财政部长停止铸造新硬币
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统说，他已下令停止铸造新便士，因为它们的制造成本高于其价值。【原文：President Donald Trump said he has ordered a stop to minting new pennies because they cost more to make than they’re worth.】

item.title: 莫迪总理访美，"中国+1 "贸易成焦点
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 加密货币大涨，比特币囤积者在日本的股票飙升 4000
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）支持加密货币的议程所产生的连锁反应正在推动日本的比特币需求激增，在日本，一位酒店经营者转而囤积加密货币，为股东带来了令人瞠目的回报。【原文：The ripple effects of US President Donald Trump’s pro-crypto agenda are fueling a surge in Bitcoin demand in Japan, where one hotelier’s pivot to stockpiling the cryptocurrency is delivering eye-watering returns for shareholders.】

item.title: 台湾计划增加购买美国液化天然气以减少贸易顺差
item.description: 台湾正准备从美国购买更多液化天然气，以减少贸易顺差，并有可能避免更高的关税。【原文：Taiwan is preparing to buy more liquefied natural gas from the US to reduce its trade surplus and potentially avoid higher tariffs.】

item.title: 新兴市场货币下滑，特朗普的金属关税打击了市场情绪
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在最新一轮关税大战中将矛头指向金属行业，新兴市场货币因此下滑，令投资者惶恐不安。【原文：Emerging market currencies slipped as US president Donald Trump targeted the metals industry in his latest tariff salvo, keeping investors on edge.】

item.title: 东风汽车大涨，重组消息点燃整合希望
item.description: 东风汽车集团股份有限公司（Dongfeng Motor Group Co.）的股价在香港大涨近 90%，此前这家中国汽车制造商表示，其母公司计划进行重组，投资者猜测此举可能会启动中国竞争异常激烈的汽车市场的整合。【原文：Shares in Dongfeng Motor Group Co. surged almost 90% in Hong Kong after the Chinese automaker said its parent company plans to restructure, a move investors speculated could kick start consolidation in the nation’s ultra competitive car market.】

item.title: 韩国反对党领袖提议追加 210 亿美元预算
item.description: 韩国反对党领袖李在明提议编制至少价值30万亿韩元（约合210亿美元）的额外预算，以支撑因政治不确定性和唐纳德-特朗普的关税威胁而紧张的经济。【原文：South Korea’s opposition leader Lee Jae-myung proposed compiling an extra budget worth at least 30 trillion won ($21 billion) to prop up the economy strained by political uncertainties and Donald Trump’s tariff threats.】
